result.execSummary:
The defendant Calvin D Otis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Calvin D Otis is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Calvin D Otis was found guilty of Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g) [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

superMiscConds.notes: Conditions same as probation conditions, exception is the condition time.

miscConds.notes: Pay all mandatory court costs, fees and surcharges.  To be paid prior to the end of probation. Failure to pay will result in the entry of a civil judgment.

Provide a DNA sample if one has not previously been provided.
No possession nor use of any weaopns.  No voting until civil rights are restored. Court advised defendant on Extended Confinement or "bad time".

No alcohol or drugs.
No new arrests rising to probable cause.
No contact with the codefendant.

Complete a parenting program.
Complete a cognitive thinking/behavioral modification program.
Court ordered no suspension of license.
AODA assessment.  Cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.  Absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens.

timeConds.notes:
STAYED until 4/16/15 by noon.
Huber for work/treatment/school and childcare.

records.addlTxt: Filed, signed Order Concerning Sentence Adjustment.  The Court Orders the petition for sentence adjustment is denied because it is not in the public interest.  Copies to the DA's office and the defendant.
Per order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to Hon. Janet C. Protasiewicz, Br. 24, calendar successor, for review. spc
Count 6

Defendant Calvin D Otis in court with attorney Awni M Yasin.  Megan M. Williamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy Court Clerk:  ss

AS TO COUNT 6 ONLY:

  Sentencing proceeds. No corrections made to PSI report. Statements made by the State, defense counsel and defendant. 

Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 36 MONTHS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 18 MONTHS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 18 MONTHS. Credit given for 1 day time served if revoked.
.
COURT STAYS sentence and places defendant on PROBATION for 2 YEARS.
.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION/EXTENDED SUPERVISION: 
-AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department;
-absolute sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs;
-random urine screens;
-No new arrests rising to probable cause
-provide a DNA sample if one has not previously been provided;
--Court ordered all  mandatorycourt costs, fees and surcharges to be paid prior to the end of probation.  Failure to pay will result in the entry of a civil mjudgment
-no contact with the co-defendant
-complete a Parenting Program
-Complete a Cognitive Thinking/Behavorial Modification mProgram
-Obtain and maintain full time employment/education
-CONDITION TIME:  6 months in the House of Corrction with huber for work/treatment/school and child care.  Stayed until 04-16-15 by noon
-Court ordered no suspension of license
.-No possession nor use of any weapons.  No voting until civil rights are restoredCourt advised defendant on Extended Confinement or "bad time".
Defendant is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
Appeal rights given. Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence and Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed. Acknowledgment of ineligibility  Copies given to defendant.
Justice Point Report.

Defendant Calvin D Otis in court with attorney Awni M Yasin.  Megan M. Williamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Discussions held off the record.  On the record, parties request an adjournment.  Attorney Yasin has a tight calendar on this adjourned date.  This case will be called first.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Calvin D Otis in court.  Megan M. Williamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Ronald Shikora ill with the flu.  Matter rescheduled for sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 3, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Justice Point Report.
Presentence Report received and filed. sab
Justice Point Report

Defendant Calvin D Otis in court with attorney Ronald C. Shikora.  Nathaniel Emery Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews and addressed violation report.  Court admonishes defendant.  Bail to remain the same.  Case to remain calendared for Sentencing.

Defendant Calvin D Otis in court with attorney Ronald C. Shikora who appears via telephone.  Carole R. Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  ENTRY MADE WITHOUT THE COURT FILE.  Present in court is Justice Point Case Worker Meghan Wautier.  Case in court due to violation.  Arguments heard as to bail.  Court admonishes Defendant.  No action taken at this time, however, Court adjourns matter before the Judge.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for December 2, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Calvin D Otis in court with attorney Ronald C. Shikora.  Megan M. Williamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
AS TO COUNT 6:
  Defendant  advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.   Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. 
AS TO COUNT 10:
On motion of the State, Court ordered Count 2 DISMISSED.
Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms; also defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Court ordered a Presentence Investigation Report. Case calendared for SENTENCING on 1/15/2015 at 1:30 pm in Branch 15.

Defendant Calvin D Otis in court with attorney Ronald C. Shikora.  Nathaniel Emery Adamson for Megan M Williamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Matter before court for Motion Hearing. No motions filed. Defense requests a Final pretrial and Jury trial date.  Court orders case adjourned to Branch 15.   Felony Pretrial Scheduling Order, signed and filed.  Final pre-trial scheduled for November 7, 2014 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for December 1, 2014 at 09:00 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Calvin D Otis in court with attorney Ronald C. Shikora, by phone.  Megan M. Williamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Case calendared for MOTION HEARING on 9/25/2014 at 1:30 pm in Branch 15. Any motions are to be filed by 8/20/2014 and any response from the State is to be filed by 9/19/2014 in Branch 15.

Per Chief Judge Directive of 14-08, parties are advised that effective August 3, 2014 this case will be assigned to Branch 15, Judge J. D. Watts, in Room G55 of the Criminal Justice Facility.

Transcript HEARING commencing MAY 13, 2014  received and filed.  Original transcript in case file 14CF1682  (42 Pages).

Defendant Calvin D Otis in court with attorney Ronald C Shikora.  Megan M Williamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Preliminary hearing proceeded. Upon oral motion by the State, Court amends the criminal complaint to reflect the correction of case# "08CF5943" on page 8.  Sworn for the state:Vincent Lopez-MPD Officer.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 16, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Report dated 5/12/14.

  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Calvin D Otis in court with attorney Kathryn A Holtz.  Defendant Calvin D Otis in custody.  Kristin M Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.
